text:
Anne Stevenson (January 3, 1933 – September 14, 2020) was an American-British poet and writer. She recipient of a Lannan Literary Award, which she won in 2007. Stevenson was born in Cambridge, England. In the 1960s she lived and wrote in Cambridge, Glasgow, Dundee and Oxford. She was writer in residence at the University of Dundee and co-founded "Other Poetry" (magazine). She wrote the controversial biography of the American poet Sylvia Plath.
Stevenson died on September 14, 2020 at the age of 87.
